summary: This bill, HR 3078, amends the Department of Energy Research and Innovation Act. It directs the Secretary of Energy, in coordination with other federal officials (Attorney General, Secretary of Homeland Security, and Postmaster General), to conduct research, development, testing, and evaluation of new technologies to detect fentanyl vapor or particles. The aim is to improve rapid screening in the mails, prisons, at U.S. borders, and other relevant locations.
